intro: Malvastrum peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Malvastrum peruvianum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
